subtitle: I want to show you what happens when you
sleep the important times to sleep and
why there's a little tiny gland in the
base of the brain and it's called the
pineal gland the pineal gland releases
four hormones every night but only in
certain hours between 10:00 p.m. and 300
a.m. light and dark signals are fed
through the optic nerve to a control
center in the brain where your body
clock is located and your body clock
communicates with the pine gland and
these are the hormones that are released
one is melatonin a lot of people have
heard of melatonin some people that
don't sleep very well take melatonin
another hormone is serotonin that's the
mood hormone another hormone that's
released in these hours is argine
vasitos argine vasitos is our natural
painkiller the other hormone that's
released is epithalamus an
epithalamic
